glsa.title: sysstat: Arbitrary code execution
glsa.synopsis: A use-after-free in sysstat was discovered which may allow arbitrary code execution.

background.p: sysstat is a package containing a number of performance monitoring utilities for Linux, including sar, mpstat, iostat and sa tools.

description.p: A double-free in sysstatâ€™s check_file_actlst() function was discovered.

impact.p: A local attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or cause a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All sysstat users should upgrade to the latest version:
